verses.roman:
mahā-pātre mahāprabhu karilā vidāya
kāndite kāndite sei tīre rahi' cāya

synonyms: mahā-pātre—unto the mahā-pātra; mahāprabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; karilā vidāya—bade farewell; kāndite kāndite—crying and crying; sei—that mahā-pātra; tīre—on the bank; rahi' cāya—stood and watched.
translation: Finally Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu bade farewell to the mahā-pātra. Standing on the river bank and looking at the boat, the mahā-pātra began to cry.
